intro: Hydrolea auriculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Hydrolea auriculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
